speaker: You
text: Hey, welcome aboard, Sam! How’s your first week going?
ipa: heɪ | ˈwɛlkəm əˈbɔrd sæm | haʊz jɚ fɝst wiːk ˈɡoʊɪŋ
stress: HEY | WELCOME ABOARD, SAM | HOW’S YOUR FIRST WEEK GOING
linking:
"welcome aboard" → /ˈwɛlkəm əˈbɔrd/ (m links into a)
"how’s your" → /haʊz jɚ/ (how is + your contracted)
"first week" → /fɝst wiːk/ (t links into W)

speaker: Sam
text: Thanks! It’s been good so far. A bit overwhelming, but I’m slowly getting the hang of everything.
ipa: θæŋks | ɪts bɪn ɡʊd soʊ fɑr | ə bɪt ˌoʊvɚˈwɛlmɪŋ | bət aɪm ˈsloʊli ˈɡɛtɪŋ ðə hæŋ əv ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ
stress: THANKS | IT’S BEEN GOOD SO FAR | A BIT OVERWHELMING | BUT I’M SLOWLY GETTING THE HANG OF EVERYTHING
linking:
"bit overwhelming" → /bɪt ˌoʊvɚˈwɛlmɪŋ/ (t links into vowel)
"getting the" → /ˈɡɛtɪŋ ðə/ (link T + article)
"hang of" → /hæŋ əv/ (link NG + of)

speaker: You
text: Totally normal. By next week, you will have settled in more. We're all here to help, so don’t hesitate to reach out.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli ˈnɔrməl | baɪ nɛkst wiːk | ju wɪl həv ˈsɛtld ɪn mɔr | wɚ ɔl hɪr tə hɛlp | soʊ doʊnt ˈhɛzɪˌteɪt tə ˈriːʧ aʊt
stress: TOTALLY NORMAL | BY NEXT WEEK | YOU WILL HAVE SETTLED IN MORE | WE’RE ALL HERE TO HELP | SO DON’T HESITATE TO REACH OUT
linking:
"will have" → /wɪl həv/ (have reduced)
"settled in" → /ˈsɛtld ɪn/ (d links to vowel)
"hesitate to" → /ˈhɛzɪˌteɪt tə/ (to reduced)
"reach out" → /ˈriːʧ aʊt/ (smooth phrasal)

speaker: Sam
text: Appreciate it. I heard I’ll be working on the API refactor project. Is that right?
ipa: əˈpriːʃieɪt ɪt | aɪ hɝd aɪl bi ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn ði ˌeɪpiˈaɪ riˈfæktɚ ˈprɑːʤɛkt | ɪz ðæt raɪt
stress: APPRECIATE IT | I HEARD I’LL BE WORKING ON THE API REFACTOR PROJECT | IS THAT RIGHT
linking:
"heard I’ll" → /hɝd aɪl/ (d links into contraction)
"working on" → /ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn/ (smooth)
"is that" → /ɪz ðæt/ (z links to th)

speaker: You
text: Yeah! You are going to join the backend squad on Monday. By then, they will have wrapped up the initial planning.
ipa: jæ | ju ɑr ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə ʤɔɪn ðə ˈbækˌɛnd skwɑd ɑn ˈmʌndeɪ | baɪ ðɛn | ðeɪ wɪl həv ræpt ʌp ði ɪˈnɪʃəl ˈplænɪŋ
stress: YEAH | YOU ARE GOING TO JOIN THE BACKEND SQUAD ON MONDAY | BY THEN | THEY WILL HAVE WRAPPED UP THE INITIAL PLANNING
linking:
"going to" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə/ (to reduced)
"wrapped up" → /ræpt ʌp/ (t links to up)
"planning" → /ˈplænɪŋ/ (smooth finish)

speaker: Sam
text: Great. I am planning to read through the API docs this weekend so I can hit the ground running.
ipa: ɡreɪt | aɪ əm ˈplænɪŋ tə riːd θru ði ˌeɪpiˈaɪ dɑks ðɪs ˈwiːkˌɛnd | soʊ aɪ kən hɪt ðə ɡraʊnd ˈrʌnɪŋ
stress: GREAT | I AM PLANNING TO READ THROUGH THE API DOCS THIS WEEKEND | SO I CAN HIT THE GROUND RUNNING
linking:
"planning to" → /ˈplænɪŋ tə/ (to reduced)
"so I can" → /soʊ aɪ kən/ (smooth sequence)
"hit the" → /hɪt ðə/ (T links to article)

speaker: You
text: Awesome. And next Thursday, we are presenting the roadmap to stakeholders, so you’ll get a clear view of where things are headed.
ipa: ˈɔsəm | ənd nɛkst ˈθɝzdeɪ | wi ɑr prɪˈzɛntɪŋ ðə ˈroʊdˌmæp tə ˈsteɪkˌhoʊldɚz | soʊ jul ɡɛt ə klɪr vju əv wɛr θɪŋz ɑr ˈhɛdɪd
stress: AWESOME | NEXT THURSDAY | WE ARE PRESENTING THE ROADMAP TO STAKEHOLDERS | YOU’LL GET A CLEAR VIEW OF WHERE THINGS ARE HEADED
linking:
"presenting the" → /prɪˈzɛntɪŋ ðə/ (smooth)
"get a" → /ɡɛt ə/ (t links to a)
"view of" → /vju əv/ (view links into article)

speaker: Sam
text: Nice! Will I be expected to contribute to the presentation?
ipa: naɪs | wɪl aɪ bi ɪkˈspɛktɪd tə kənˈtrɪbjut tə ðə ˌprɛzənˈteɪʃən
stress: NICE | WILL I BE EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PRESENTATION
linking:
"expected to" → /ɪkˈspɛktɪd tə/ (to reduced)
"contribute to" → /kənˈtrɪbjut tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: You
text: Not this time, but I’m sure by next quarter you will be leading one of them! If you keep up this pace, you will have learned a ton in just a few weeks.
ipa: nɑt ðɪs taɪm | bət aɪm ʃʊr baɪ nɛkst ˈkwɔrtɚ ju wɪl bi ˈliːdɪŋ wʌn əv ðɛm | ɪf ju kiːp ʌp ðɪs peɪs | ju wɪl həv lɝnd ə tʌn ɪn ʤəst ə fju wiːks
stress: NOT THIS TIME | BUT I’M SURE BY NEXT QUARTER YOU WILL BE LEADING ONE OF THEM | IF YOU KEEP UP THIS PACE | YOU WILL HAVE LEARNED A TON IN JUST A FEW WEEKS
linking:
"but I’m" → /bət aɪm/ (but reduced)
"one of them" → /wʌn əv ðɛm/ (of reduced)
"have learned" → /həv lɝnd/ (have reduced)

speaker: Sam
text: Haha, let’s hope so! Do you remember what your onboarding was like?
ipa: ˈhɑːhɑː | lɛts hoʊp soʊ | dʊ ju rɪˈmɛmbɚ wʌt jɚ ˈɑːnbɔrdɪŋ wəz laɪk
stress: HAHA | LET’S HOPE SO | DO YOU REMEMBER WHAT YOUR ONBOARDING WAS LIKE
linking:
"let’s hope" → /lɛts hoʊp/ (s links into h)
"what your" → /wʌt jɚ/ (T links into pronoun)

speaker: You
text: Oh yeah, I was about to give up after the first few days. But I got used to it quickly once I started working on real tasks. Everyone was willing to help, so I never felt alone.
ipa: oʊ jæ | aɪ wəz əˈbaʊt tə ɡɪv ʌp ˈæftɚ ðə fɝst fju deɪz | bət aɪ ɡɑt ˈjuːst tə ɪt ˈkwɪkli wʌns aɪ ˈstɑːrtɪd ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn riːəl tæsks | ˈɛvrɪwʌn wəz ˈwɪlɪŋ tə hɛlp | soʊ aɪ ˈnɛvɚ fɛlt əˈloʊn
stress: OH YEAH | I WAS ABOUT TO GIVE UP AFTER THE FIRST FEW DAYS | BUT I GOT USED TO IT QUICKLY | STARTED WORKING ON REAL TASKS | EVERYONE WAS WILLING TO HELP | I NEVER FELT ALONE
linking:
"about to" → /əˈbaʊt tə/ (to reduced)
"used to" → /ˈjuːst tə/ (to reduced)
"working on" → /ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn/ (verb + preposition)

speaker: Sam
text: That’s reassuring. Thanks for all the help so far!
ipa: ðæts ˌriːəˈʃʊrɪŋ | θæŋks fər ɔl ðə hɛlp soʊ fɑr
stress: THAT’S REASSURING | THANKS FOR ALL THE HELP SO FAR
linking:
"thanks for" → /θæŋks fər/ (ks links into preposition)
"so far" → /soʊ fɑr/ (smooth connection)

speaker: You
text: Of course! Let’s check in again after your first sprint. You’re off to a solid start!
ipa: əv kɔrs | lɛts ʧɛk ɪn əˈɡɛn ˈæftɚ jɚ fɝst sprɪnt | jɚ ɑf tə ə ˈsɑːlɪd stɑrt
stress: OF COURSE | LET’S CHECK IN AGAIN AFTER YOUR FIRST SPRINT | YOU’RE OFF TO A SOLID START
linking:
"check in" → /ʧɛk ɪn/ (smooth phrasal)
"after your" → /ˈæftɚ jɚ/ (r links into pronoun)
"off to a" → /ɑf tə ə/ (to + a reduced)
